ast.name: Cloud Checkers
ast.comment:
Wabbit Apps: Ported code to use TouchDevelop boxes instead of game board.

This is an 8x8 implementation of Checkers a.k.a English Draughts.

To make a move, player will tap the piece (which will highlight the box) and then tap the box where he/she wants to move the piece.

Following features are planned till project submission date:
1. Piece capture.
2. The game will restrict illegal moves.
3. Highlight legal moves.
4. King pieces

Following features might not be implemented due to time constraints (although I would try my best to include them):
1. Graphics and sounds
2. Settings page (customisations such as board color, men color)
3. Mandatory piece capture

No graphics or images has been used till now. The board and pieces are all created through code. Game works best in portrait mode.

The game is written without any game programming experience, so please excuse the abnormalities :)

None of the code is copied from any source!

Note: Throughout comments and descriptions, 'Pieces and Men' and 'Tiles and Boxes'are used interchangeably.

decls.name: lastSelection
decls.comment: Stores the checkerBoxes table record corresponding to the last selection

body.text: This function is used to initialise some of the important global variables
Clear required tables and collections
highlight = True [Highlights the valid moves]
highlight = False [Restore the original colors]
Function name is self explanatory.

decls.name: justCaptured
decls.comment: Determines if player has just captured a piece. Used for multiple capture scenarios

body.text: If all the men (pieces) are captured for a player, raise the flag.
Ends the game. The 'man' field of the checkerBoxes table is cleared to make sure players are not able to select any box after the game is finished.
The function checks if there's any piece capturing opponent's piece. This is used to enforce the mandatory capture
Provided a box, the function determines if there's a possibility of capture

For a piece, there could be maximum 4 valid moves. These moves can either be in the near diagonals or (in case of capture) far diagonals. This function gets all the near diagonals and stores the diagonal numbers in a number collection
nearDiagonals -> at(i) = A number greater than 0 [Valid near diagonal]
nearDiagonals -> at(i) =  0 [Opponent's piece on the diagonal] nearDiagonals -> at(i) = -1 [Invalid near diagonal]
Black

For a piece, there could be maximum 4 valid moves. These moves can either be in the near diagonals or (in case of capture) far diagonals. This function gets all the far diagonals and stores the diagonal numbers in a number collection
farDiagonals -> at(i) = A number greater than 0 [Valid far diagonal]
farDiagonals -> at(i) =  0 [Opponent's piece on the diagonal]
farDiagonals -> at(i) = -1 [Invalid far diagonal]
Black
Captures a man!
Given a box, calculates all the valid moves and populates the 'validMoves' collection
Given a box, converts the piece to a King.
Function loops through all the positions defined in 'InitialPositions' string collection and creates the piece (man) at the center of the box according to the position.
Moves the piece from 'source' to 'destination'
Check if piece is eligible to become King
Continue player's turn for multiple capture
This event is the heart of the app. Event handles taps on the boxes.

When the user taps on a box, the code Check if user is 'selecting a piece' OR 'making the move'. If the user is selecting a piece, check if he/she can select the piece. If the selection is valid, highlight the selected box and also highlight the available valid moves.

If the user is making a move, check if the move is valid. Making an invalid move or tapping on the already selected box will cancel the move. If everything's good, move the piece. While moving the piece check if the user is capturing opponent's piece.
If Box is not already selected

thenBody.text: Box will be selected only if there's a man on that box and it's that color's turn

elseBody.text: If box was already selected (the user is making a move)
If the user taps the selected box again, the box will be deselected

thenBody.text: there is a Y, but don't have other response

body.text: Top Right
Bottom Left (for Kings only)

thenBody.text: there is a Y, but don't have other response
